fourthDataScreenScreen.title: Your Self-procedure Plan:
fourthDataScreenScreen.description: This plan will be adapted to you. After each self-procedure, the time until the next one will be calculated, and notifications will be activated. Always do it until the end of the interval.
fourthDataScreenScreen.notification_Description: You will receive notifications to procedure on time!
fourthDataScreenScreen.notice: The optimal frequency of procedures is 4-6 times a day. If more than 400ml of urine is released per procedure, it is recommended to increase the frequency of procedures. Adhere to the procedure interval prescribed by your doctor.

waterBalanceComponent.title: Water Balance
waterBalanceComponent.description: Normal diuresis is 75-80% of the amount of fluid intake.

intervals.negative_text: (<75%): This range indicates that the volume of urination is less than 75% of the volume of fluid intake.
intervals.normal_text: (75-80%): This is the optimal ratio where the urine volume is 75-80% of the volume of fluid intake. This indicates a healthy water balance.
intervals.positive_text: (80-100%): This range indicates that the urine volume is 80-100% of the volume of fluid intake. Increased diuresis, the body excretes more fluid than usual.

clueAtTheBottom.title: You can always change this selection in the tab.

waterBalanceScreen.waterBalanceInfo: Water balance is the ratio between the amount of fluid entering the body and the amount of fluid leaving the body over a specific period of time. Measuring your fluid intake and urine output will help you maintain optimal hydration levels in your body.

recommendationScreen.title: Recommendations
recommendationScreen.nelaton_app_description: The Nelaton app is your personal assistant for self-procedure. Your doctor should have already explained the reasons why you need to do it and taught you how to perform the procedure. It is important to carefully read the instructions for the procedure you are going to use.

timer.question: How does the timer on the main screen work?
timer.answer: The timer counts down to the next procedure. You need to do it before the timer runs out to stick to the schedule set by your doctor. If you miss the scheduled procedure, the timer will show the time that has passed since the last one. After each procedure, go into the app and press the 'Done' button to start the countdown for the next procedure.

frequency.question: How often do I need to do it?
frequency.answer: The frequency of procedure is determined by your doctor, based on your condition. It's also important to note that the frequency may change. We help you easily track your urination habits, which helps your doctor adjust the interval between procedures as needed. It‚Äôs recommended to perform self-procedure regularly throughout the day, depending on the volume of fluids you consume and your doctor‚Äôs recommendations. You may need to to it every 4-6 hours to ensure that the urine volume in the bladder does not exceed 400 ml. If you do not do it frequently enough and your bladder becomes overfilled, the risk of urinary tract infections and leakage increases. Prolonged bladder stretching can cause serious damage to the kidneys.

water.question: How much water should I drink?
water.answer: Adults should drink at least 1.5 liters of water a day. This is just a recommendation, and you should consult your doctor to know how much water is right for you. Remember, water is the best drink. It's recommended to avoid caffeinated drinks, as caffeine irritates the bladder. Drinking enough water helps flush the urinary system. The Nelaton app helps you track your hydration levels. You can log your water intake on the main screen using the '+Drank' button, and the 'Water Balance' screen lets you monitor your fluid intake and urine output.

infection_prevention.question: How can I prevent urinary tract infections?
infection_prevention.answer: Maintain hygiene, regularly and completely empty your bladder, and drink enough fluids. We recommend filling out our procedure satisfaction survey at least once a month and sharing it with your doctor.

night_catheterization.question: Do I need to do it at night?
night_catheterization.answer: Usually, it‚Äôs enough to do it before bed and right after waking up, then continue at intervals throughout the day. However, your doctor will advise you on what's best for you. The app helps you follow any schedule and interval of procedure. You can set up a nighttime procedure, follow the interval during the night, or even disable nighttime procedure by enabling sleep mode. It all depends on your doctor‚Äôs advice, and our app is ready to help you follow any schedule.

catheters_tracking.question: How do I track procedure usage?
catheters_tracking.answer: The app automatically tracks procedure usage. You need to specify how many procedure you have and whether you use additional supplies during procedure (such as aseptic wipes, urine bags, gloves, etc.). This will help you keep track of how many procedure and necessary supplies you have and replenish them in time. Every time you press the 'Done' button, the app will deduct the appropriate amount of supplies. When you purchase procedure and other supplies, don‚Äôt forget to update the quantity in the app.

travel_abroad.question: What should I do when traveling abroad?
travel_abroad.answer: Take enough procedure with you and carry a medical certificate confirming their necessity. This certificate will help you pass security checks at airports or other events with heightened security measures. On the 'procedure Usage' tab, you can calculate how many procedure you need to take with you based on your average consumption.

missing_feature.question: What should I do if a feature is missing from the app?
missing_feature.answer: Write to us using the form on this page. Describe the situation you encountered and what functionality you feel is missing in the Nelaton app. We will consider your suggestions in future updates.

questionnaireScreen.question_one: How often do you experience pain or discomfort during procedure?
questionnaireScreen.question_two: Have there been any cases of bleeding after procedure?
questionnaireScreen.question_three: Have you experienced signs of infection after procedure, such as fever, frequent urination, pain, or burning?
questionnaireScreen.question_four: Have you had any allergic reactions or skin irritation caused by the procedure or lubricants?
questionnaireScreen.question_five: How would you rate the ease of use of the procedure and lubricants?
questionnaireScreen.question_six: Did you experience any difficulties with procedure due to insufficient training on the procedure?
questionnaireScreen.question_seven: Were there any instances where procedure failed, requiring urgent medical attention?
questionnaireScreen.question_eight: Did you encounter any difficulties inserting the procedure? If yes, please describe the difficulties encountered.
questionnaireScreen.question_nine: What additional problems or complications related to procedure would you like to mention?

consumableItems.consumable_items_description: If you use additional consumables during procedure, you can account for their consumption. To do this, include what you need or add a new one.

personalizationScreen.title: Personalize Your Urination Diary
personalizationScreen.description: This data will be reflected in the PDF version of your urination diary. The filled information will help the doctor recognize your document and use it to monitor your health and adjust treatment if necessary.
personalizationScreen.which_catheter_do_you_use: Which procedure do you use? Model Name/Manufacturer
personalizationScreen.which_catheter_do_you_use_hint: You can find this information on the procedure packaging you use
personalizationScreen.additional_information: Here you can leave additional information for the doctor (diagnoses, types of injuries, medication intake)
personalizationScreen.volume_info: "general" norms: Women - 250-500 ml, Men - 350-700 ml, Children - 35-400 ml (depending on age)

few_drops.description: Few drops ‚Äì minor, almost unnoticeable leakage that amounts to approximately up to 5 ml.

small.description: Small ‚Äì light leakage that amounts to approximately 5 to 20 ml (about one teaspoon to half a tablespoon).

moderate.description: Moderate ‚Äì moderate leakage that amounts to approximately 20-50 ml (about half or slightly less than the volume of a shot glass).

large.description: Large ‚Äì heavy leakage exceeding 50 ml (about half a glass).
